timeline:
{
"1940":"the beginning of service in the Workers 'and Peasants' Red Army, the service in Murmansk in the anti-aircraft artillery unit",
"1944":"redeployment to Poland, participation in the Vistula-Oder operation and in the Berlin offensive operation as part of a search company",
"1945":"during the Great Patriotic War, the commander of the rifle detachment of the Komsomol division",
"1948-1950":"study at the Republican Party School",
"1980-1992":"Chief Editor of the Belarusian Soviet Encyclopedia Publishing House"
}
masterpieces:
{
"1949":"Deep Current",
"1957":"The Unique Spring",
"1958":"Night light",
"1968":"Evening Session",
"1997":"Grand Duchess"
}
title: en_ivan_shamyakin
snippet:
{
"photo":"https://www.peoples.ru/military/hero/shamyakin/shamyakin_12.jpg",
"fullName":"Ivan Petrovich Shamyakin",
"birthDate":"1921",
"deathDate":"2004",
"birthCity":"Korma village, Dobrush district, Gomel region",
"deathCity":"Minsk",
"description":"Belarusian Soviet writer, screenwriter and playwright, public figure. People's writer of the Belarusian SSR (1972). Hero of Socialist Labor (1981). Laureate of the Stalin Prize of the third degree (1951). Member of the CPSU (b) since 1943. Academician National Academy of Sciences of Belarus (1994). "
}
